yoruba: Àì-kúkú-joye, ó sàn ju, “Ẹnuù mi ò ká ìlú” lọ.
gold: Not-assuming-the-position-of-ruler-at-all is far better than, “My word is not heeded by the people.”
gen: The Yoruba proverb "Àì-kúkú-joye, ó sàn ju, “Ẹnuù mi ò ká ìlú” lọ" translates to English as "It is better not to accept a chieftaincy title than to say, 'I cannot handle the responsibilities of the community.'" This proverb emphasizes the importance of being prepared and capable before taking on significant responsibilities or roles.
